newsitem.title: LEBANON: SLA militiaman killed, four wounded in Lebanon.
newsitem.headline: SLA militiaman killed, four wounded in Lebanon.

text.p: A pro-Israeli militiaman was killed and four wounded on Tuesday in a guerrilla rocket attack in south Lebanon, pro-Israeli security sources said.

They said a rocket hit a South Lebanon Army (SLA) motorised patrol on its way to the outpost of Deir Harfa in the western sector of Israel's south Lebanon occupation zone, killing one militiaman and wounding four.

In Beirut, the pro-Iranian Hizbollah claimed responsibility for the attack which raised to two the number of SLA militiamen killed and to 10 the number of wounded in attacks since the beginning of the year.
In retaliation, Israeli and SLA artillery men shelled south Lebanon areas facing the outpost.
Hizbollah (Party of God) leads an Islamic resistance committed to ousting Israeli troops and their local militia allies from the 15-km (nine miles)-wide occupation zone.
